title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Music Reading Learning Design: Interface Comparison Study

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Corporate social education program focusing on cultivating practical music-reading skills through smartphone-based music education tools.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify notes, rhythms, and beats in musical scores of varying difficulty levels
Learners can create beginner-to-intermediate level musical scores using a music software interface
Learners can apply cognitive load minimization strategies (e.g., using visual aids) to real-world music reading situations

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
